name: mycoprotein
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a substance in fungi (= organisms that get their food from decaying material or other living things) that is used to make a food eaten instead of meat, or the food itself : Fungi are also being used to produce mycoproteins. Mycoprotein is reported to have a high protein content, and to contain all essential amino acids.
More examplesFewer examplesMycoprotein is distantly related to mushrooms.The fungal strain used to make mycoprotein has lost its ability to cause diseases in plants.The cells of mycoprotein grow rapidly by continuous aerobic fermentation in a sterile environment.
